title: (x) Neopharmed logo - Verdana {Patricia}
content:
Any idea?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829230838im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/neopharmed_4198.gif)

 [‹ (x) Retro connected round script - League Night {Mark Simonson}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829230838/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28074 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Squarish sans - Eurostile {Geoff} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829230838/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28063 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Manlio Napoli

comments.content:
Nice catch, Patty. Here’s a zoom from neopharmed.com (it’s Flash, so there is some distortion):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829230838im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/SafariScreenSnapz001_6138.jpg)

Looks like it could have been perhaps “professionally” stretched - as the strokes don’t seem to be affected they way they would with a simple [squooshing](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829230838/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/squooshed). There is also a custom ’A’ with pointed apex.

It looks pretty uneven for a professional - maybe “amateurishly” stretched.

Nick Cooke

Nick - as Stephen commented, the distortion is due to it being from Flash.

Same issue arose in the Michael Graves logo thred.

Ouch! Examples like this hurts badly... but the crusade for a better looking world goes on!  
;-)
